content.text: Directions : Each of the following sentences in this section has a blank space and four words or group of words are given after the sentence. Select the most appropriate word or group of words for the blank space and indicate your response on the Answer Sheet accordingly.The population of Mumbai and Delhi is greater than ______________ city in India.
He is one of the ________________ in the country.
He has the ______________ touch of a maestro.
He feels that he has been ____________.
Had he told me the news beforehand, I ______________ careful and saved my money.
Life has been thrown ____________ due to the weather conditions in the city.
The campaign is in ____________ .
What you propose is _____________ .
If a Time Machine _____________ you anywhere for one day, where would you go ?
He _____________ waiting for you since morning.
‘Perspicacity’ and ‘Perspicuity’

options.text: Perspicacity means ability to discern and Perspicuity means lucidity of expression
Perspicacity means lucidity of expression and Perspicuity means ability to discern
Perspicacity means tenacity and Perspicuity means lucidity of expression
Perspicacity means ability to discern and Perspicuity means tenacity

content.text: ‘Complaisant’ and ‘Complacent’

options.text: Complaisant means overconfident and Complacent means in the same place
Complaisant means eager to please and Complacent means overconfident
Complaisant means eager to please and Complacent means in the same place
Complaisant means overconfident and Complacent means eager to please

content.text: ‘Compliment’ and ‘Complement’

options.text: Compliment means to enhance and Complement means to praise
Compliment means to go well with and Complement means to praise
Compliment means to praise and Complement means to go well with
Compliment means to enhance and complement means to to go well with

content.text: ‘Deify’ and ‘Defy’

options.text: To deify means to confer upon one the status of God and to defy means to oppose
To deify means to confer upon one the status of God and to defy means to deny
To deify means to oppose and to defy means to confer upon one the status of God
To deify means to oppose and to defy means to deny

content.text: ‘Evoke’ and ‘Invoke’

options.text: Evoke means to elicit a response and Invoke means to provoke
Evoke means to call upon through an appeal and Invoke means to elicit a response
Evoke means to provoke and Invoke means to call upon through an appeal
Evoke means to elicit a response and Invoke means to call upon through an appeal

content.text: ‘Sympathy’ and ‘Empathy’

options.text: Sympathy means sharing another’s feelings and Empathy means understanding another’s feelings
Sympathy means expressing another’s feelings and Empathy means sharing another’s feelings
Sympathy means pitying another’s feelings and Empathy means emphasising another’s feelings
Sympathy means emphasising another’s feelings and Empathy means pitying another's feelings

content.text: ‘Accept’ and ‘Except’

options.text: Accept means to exclude and Except means to agree
Accept means to agree and Except means to extend
Accept means to agree and Except means to exclude
Accept means to extend and Except means to agree

content.text: ‘Reward’ and ‘Award’

options.text: Reward is compensation for effort and Award is prize for recognition
Reward is prize for recognition and Award is compensation for effort
Reward is prize for recognition and Award is gift from someone
Reward is gift from someone and Award is compensation for effort

content.text: ‘Emigrate’ and ‘Immigrate’

options.text: Emigrate means to illegally go to another country and Immigrate means to arrive at another country
Emigrate means to arrive at another country and Immigrate means to leave for another country
Emigrate means to leave for another country and Immigrate means to illegally enter a country
Emigrate means to leave for another country and Immigrate means to arrive at another country

content.text: 'Immolate’ and ‘Emulate’

options.text: Immolate means to sacrifice and Emulate means to follow someone out of admiration
Immolate means to burn and Emulate means to wear ornaments
Immolate means to burn and Emulate means to simulate
Immolate means to destroy and Emulate means to imitate

System performance was demonstrated _____________ the Drop Zone from an altitude of 5000 m.
Ranjit has been elected as _____________ leader of the group in the house.
Entry ____________ the building was restricted due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Education is a manifestation of _______________ perfection already in man.
______________ university is a place for thinking and learning.
Amid _____________ few incidents of violence, the voting went on well.
Scholars are often caught on the horns of ____________ dilemma.
You need to make others feel that you are second _____________ none.
How many students have come _____________ you for the programme ?
Rahul must have received the dues ___________ now.
It is not that I do not take a decision,

options.text: I decide not to take a decision.
I do not decide a decision.
I had not taken a decision.
I decide I would not have taken a decision.

content.text: If I were in your position,

options.text: I had been accepting this compensation.
I would not accept this compensation.
I would not have been accepting this compensation.
should I not accept the compensation.

content.text: If I were in your position,

options.text: I had been accepting this compensation.
I would not accept this compensation.
I would not have been accepting this compensation.
should I not accept the compensation.

content.text: There are many career options,

options.text: you can choose any of them.
you can choose many of them.
you should choose none of them.
you would choose one of them.

content.text: If you had prepared well,

options.text: you would have been fared well.
you must have to fare well.

content.text: Where there is a will,

options.text: there would have been a way.
there may have been a way.

content.text: “It is getting dark,

options.text: must I turn on the lights ?”
should I be turning the lights ?”
may I be turning on the lights ?”
can I turn on the lights ?”

content.text: Once I met a traveller

options.text: who said he had been to an ancient place.
he said he had been to an ancient place.
who can be said he had been to an ancient place.
he said an ancient place had been to him.

content.text: Man is the greatest truth of all,

options.text: there cannot be nothing to him.
there is nothing truth about him.

content.text: If your life is circumscribed by habits alone,

options.text: you were merely an imitating machine.
you are merely an imitative machine.
you were merely an imitative machine.
you can be living in an imitative world.

China’s objective of signing a security pact with Solomon Islands is

options.text: to contribute in ensuring security in the Pacific.
to provide financial aid in enhancing security measures in the Pacific.

content.text: The Pact symbolises China’s doctrine of

options.text: deployment of security forces wherever needed.

content.text: Which one of the following is implied by ‘Beijing would not seek to become a global hegemon’?

options.text: Beijing would aspire to become a strong ruler.
Beijing is ambitious of becoming a Superpower.
Beijing is not aspiring to have control over the world.
Beijing will play an important role in world politics.

content.text: What does ‘square with that idea’ imply in the passage ?

options.text: Not in agreement with the idea

content.text: What does ‘strategic foothold’ imply in the passage ?
What is ‘international carbon trading system’ here ?

options.text: Counting carbon emissions by poor countries
A system of counting carbons every year
The exchange of carbon credits between nations
Counting how developed countries evade accountability

content.text: What is the third issue being mentioned in the context of ‘share of the revenue’ ?

options.text: The revenue may not be shared with UN’s Adaptation Fund.
Developed countries would take the revenue from bilateral trading agreements.
Poor countries will have to shoulder the major responsibilities. .
Accounting system will be in the hands of developed countries.

content.text: ... forests to act as a carbon sink’ means

options.text: Depletion of forest cover adds to carbon emission.

content.text: What is the concern about the integrity of the accounting system ?

options.text: Developed countries and companies would not be adhering to the credit system.
Developed countries and companies would be adhering to the credit system.
Poor countries would not be adhering to  the credit system on carbon emission.
Poor countries would be adhering to the credit system on carbon emission.

content.text: Which of the following words is nearer to the meaning of the word ‘protocol’ in the text ?
What are the volatile components of inflation ?

options.text: Components such as food and fuel

content.text: What are the volatile components of inflation ?

options.text: Components such as food and fuel

content.text: In what context are the words’ ‘pass through’ used in the passage ?

options.text: That services sector will increase prices as demand picks up
That manufacturing sector is bearing the burden of input costs
That the economy is passing through price pressures
That inflation will pass through the services sector

content.text: Explain the meaning of the word ‘quotidian’ as used in the passage.
Choose the most appropriate option that describes the meaning of the term ‘unanchoring’ as used in the passage.

options.text: Stability of inflation that will be securely anchored
The rising anchor will free inflation
The disjoint between inflation and its expectations
Runaway inflation that is out of control

content.text: He is considered the harbinger.
The vista of the villages is beautiful.

S1: A licensee who wants to surrender his license shall apply in Form X to the licensing officer.P: This shall not entitle the licensee to any compensation by way of license fee in any form.Q: If the licensing officer is satisfied, he may accept the surrender.R: The license shall be deemed to have been terminated from the date of such acceptance.S: The application shall be accompanied by a declaration of stock in Form V.S6: The licensee who has surrendered his license shall be allowed to sell the antiquities declared to another licensee or a recognized museum in India.

S1 : Haryana has achieved the 2nd rank among States in Logistics Ease Across Different States (LEADS) - 2021 report.P: This makes Haryana a top performer in the northern cluster of land-locked States.Q: The State has taken a leap from the 6th overall position in the previous evaluation (2019).R: The improvement in ranking reflects focused initiatives by the State in improving the infrastructure.S: The report aims to evaluate and rank States / UTs based on the efficiency of their logistics and initiatives taken. S6 : LEADS 2021 framework evaluated States /UTs on 21 indicators, including 17 perceptions and four objectives-based indicators.

S1: Wind power is an inexhaustible source of clean energy.P: During the last decade, power production from the wind increased more than 25%.Q: Although the cost of electrical energy produced by the wind depends on favourable sites for the location of wind turbines, wind power is already cost competitive with power produced from fossil fuels.R: Much of the growth was in Europe, where most of the world's 17,000 megawatts of wind power is generated.S: One expert calls wind generation the fastest-growing electricity-producing technology in the world.S6: As examples, 13% of Denmark's power and more than 20% of power in the Netherlands, Spain and Germany is supplied by the wind.

S1: Education, it is believed, is inseparable from our societal aspirations.P: Education, as many would argue, was for realization of the Ultimate and the Absolute.Q: In ancient times, for example, there was a distinctive spiritual meaning associated with education.R: As these aspirations / world views undergo a process of transformation with the changing times, so does the meaning for education.S: It was to overcome the finiteness of existence: all earthly temptations and desires.S6 : But, for a modern / technical mind, this preoccupation with supreme spiritual knowledge may not hold such fascination.

S1: He resisted colonial education not just because it came from the West.P: Essentially, he disliked its inherent elitism, its irrelevance as far as the needs of India's rural masses were concerned.Q: For example, it was difficult for him to accept English as the medium of instruction, because he felt that it has created a permanent bar between the highly educated few and the uneducated many.R: Moreover, with his profound pedagogic sensitivity he could see the damaging effect of colonial education.S: He also felt that English made one a stranger in one's own land.S6: Besides, with this kind of education, one could not appreciate the dignity of manual labour.

S1: A corpus is an abundant source of samples of English usage.P: If this is to be of the meaning that has been previously explained, they cannot just be picked out of the corpus at random.Q: If they are to function as examples, however, then we need to ask just what it is they are intended to be examples of. R: Samples of the language, isolated from their natural context of use, will not normally exemplify word meanings, but will simply show one instance of the word's actual occurrence.S: This is because the context will usually make it unnecessary to spell the meaning out.S6: It is not only the previously explained meaning of the word that we might want a sample to exemplify, however, but also its collocational tendencies.

S1: Historians have often explained religious and social reform in India in the nineteenth century as a result of the Western impact upon the minds of men.P: With that purpose, we seek to analyze the thoughts and activities of individuals who were both religious reformers and vernacular publicists.Q: The equation of westernization and modernization has given way to a search for the indigenous sources of social changes.R: Recognizing the modernity of tradition is one thing however, whereas understanding the intellectual processes that produced indigenously generated change is another.S: Others have recognized that this was entirely too simple an explanation for the intellectual and social changes that took place in India and other places that fell under the foreign colonial rule.S6: Each of these vernacular-using reformers derived his arguments from within his own tradition.

S1 : The country has experienced unprecedented economic development since the adoption of the New Economic Policy in the year 1999.P: The middle classes have been the greatest beneficiary of the policy, who today enjoy far greater levels of income than their previous generations.Q : In the immediate aftermath of the newly announced policy, there was apprehension in the minds of the people.R: Within a few years, however, the beneficial impact of the newly announced policy became manifest through higher GDP and a thriving economy .S: Faced with a critical foreign exchange crisis, the country adopted the policy in the Union Budget presented in the year 1999.S6: If the country dreams of a much larger economy today, much of the optimism is due to the policy changes that took place in the year 1999.

S1: The Indian co-operative movement is probably one of the largest, strongest and the oldest in the world with widespread spatial coverage, diversified business activities and ample success stories.P: It has celebrated its Centenary very recently.Q: It is structured around the Rochdale Principles and Raiffeisen Model in wake of miseries of peasantry.R: It is termed as the “economic miracle” of the last century.S: Ever since the officially sponsored Act of 1904, the Movement has passed through a number of phases.S6: Co-operatives have been organized in areas like credit, marketing, distribution, dairy development, industry, sugar and so on.

S1 : Degenerative and man-made diseases, or rather, non-communicable diseases mark epidemiological transition in the contemporary world.P: Scholars reiterate that epidemiological transition and structural change in the disease pattern are inevitable.Q: This transition is the result of rapid increments in urbanization and industrialization.R: He argued that the disease pattern is shifting from the predominance of infectious and parasitic diseases to chronic and man-made diseases.S: Omran's epidemiological transition theory, 1971 portrayed a clear picture of the changing pattern of diseases prevalent all over the world.S6: This transition has led to the rise of living standards in general, whereby people enjoy a sedentary lifestyle with good socio-economic profile.
‘Alibi’

options.text: The accused was acquitted because he provided an alibi.
The accused was acquitted because his alibi was not accepted.
The accused was acquitted because his alibi was false.
The accused was convicted because he provided an alibi.

content.text: ‘Continuously’

options.text: The waves lapped upon the shores continuously.
The fellows at the academy follow their exercise routine continuously.
The giant piston at the oil rig hammered the ground continuously.
The water was flowing from the leaking tap continuously.

content.text: 'Elicit'

options.text: The call centre's operations were found to be elicit
The elicit ties between them were discovered by chance.
The demand for further information did not elicit an enthusiastic response.
The elicit reasons stated were found to be insufficient.

content.text: ‘Climactic’

options.text: The climactic degradations shall lead to cataclysmic weather change.
The climactic changes in the environment will impact the entire world.
The climactic outcomes of restrained sustainability are positive.
The climactic changes presaging environmental disaster are predicted to unfold soon.

content.text: ‘Affect’

options.text: The new diet did not seem to have any affect on her health.
For the new scheme to take affect, certain conditions have to be met.
In affect, we are back to where we were before.
The changed circumstances seemed to visibly affect her.

content.text: ‘Discrete’

options.text: The manager was asked to make discrete enquiries about the new client.
The discrete noise-cancelling headphones are very expensive.
The discrete series had many intervening gaps.
It is important to be discrete while dealing with sensitive material.

content.text: ‘It’s’

options.text: It's nature is susceptible to rapid change.
What is it about it’s performance that has impressed you ?
It’s imperative that you study hard for success.
What about it’s value in the international market ?

content.text: ‘Amidst’

options.text: Amidst them who do you think is better
There was a lot of confusion amidst his mind.
Amidst all the confusion the thief managed to slink away unnoticed.
Who amidst you shall be brave enough to pick up the gauntlet ?

content.text: ‘Less’

options.text: There are less than fourteen people attending the seminar.
Less states are fulfilling the targets set by the union ministry.
There is less sugar in the tea than what I asked for.
There are very less days left before the examinations begin.

content.text: ‘Practise’

options.text: It is common practise to greet friends during festivals.
It has been the practise of academics to recommend students for higher studies.
What is the particular practise of your neighbours that you are objecting to?
It is important to practise regularly to ensure good performance on match day.
